metadata.title: CVE-2019-14433 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Nova before 17.0.12, 18.x before18.2.2, and 19.x before 19.0.2. If an API request from an authenticateduser ends in a fault condition due to an external exception, details of theunderlying environment may be leaked in the response, and could includesensitive configuration or other data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-api - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-api-metadata - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-api-os-compute - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-api-os-volume - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-cells - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-cert - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-common - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-kvm - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-lxc - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-qemu - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-vmware - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-compute-xen - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-conductor - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-console - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-consoleauth - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-network - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-novncproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-scheduler - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-serialproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-spiceproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-volume - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
python-nova - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:13.1.4-0ubuntu4.5').
